funGUI

Class Interface

  • java.lang.Object
    • funGUI.Interface

  • public class Interface
extends java.lang.Object
    The Interface class can help you organize all of your buttons, displays, etc. so that everything is neat. Interface just takes a number of rows and a number of columns.
    Author:
    audrey

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interface

        public Interface(processing.core.PApplet p,
                 int numColumns,
                 int numRows)
        Instantiates a new Interface, given the number of columns and rows. If numColumns is -1, then it spaces all its buttons/displays and such by their width. If numRows is less than -1, each widget is limited by their width and is allowed to grow in the y direction. Specifying both results in an even array-like format.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent of the sketch (usually this)
        numColumns - int, the number of columns (or -1, if columns don't matter)
        numRows - int, the number of rows (or -1, if rows don't matter)
